messages.message:
Created a bug today on validation rules.  The validation rules you create that use inputs from other fields results in the validation rule being applied to all the fields used in the function. It should only validate the field that the rule was created on.

https://instabase.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/EPD/issues/EPD-1604?jql=project[…]22%20and%20type%20%3D%20Bug%20ORDER%20BY%20created%20DESC (https://instabase.atlassian.net/jira/software/c/projects/EPD/issues/EPD-1604?jql=project%20%3D%20%22EPD%22%20and%20type%20%3D%20Bug%20ORDER%20BY%20created%20DESC)

@Lee to be clear is this for custom functions? cc @danny.lan seems like an issue of `input_fields` vs `affected_fields`. We should make sure that the reference fields are only being added as `input_fields` and not `affected_fields`

Hey @Arjun yeah this is in custom validation fields. For example in my screenshot the fields `JSON` and `Number_of_Transactions` are being passed into my custom function.

But I only added the function on the field called `JSON`. But its also being applied to the `Number_of_Transactions` field. I don’t think this is what we should do in this scenario

To confirm — you’re saying that if you go into the field editor for number of transactions you see this validation rule under the Validate section? This table simply shows all the input fields, it doesn’t necessarily mean the validation rule is being applied to that rule
Also I think the epd ticket linked is incorrect
Oops corrected the ticket. Yep here’s the other field and it shows up on there even though I added it to the field called JSON only
Definitely seems like a bug then, thanks for flagging
if we can recreate this in prepord, please fix this in 24.08 -- this is also another blocker bug to me
I ran into a similar bug on applying model confidence score validation -- not sure if this is related
@Kerry that issue is unrelated — I have a ticket to get that fixed today
Thanks @Arjun , please pick it back to 08 -- also, who should I assign Lee's ticket to (EPD-1604?)
@danny.lan would be the one with the most context probably
Thanks. Danny -- assigning this to you. cc @Eric Han here since Lydia is OOO
hmm, actually this seems to me to be a backend bug
let's communicate in the ticket or in group channels separately
this thread is getting so long
Link to follow up thread for anyone interested: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05EQQJGN7L/p1709652556593929
